title: Types of animals at county fairs

content.description: The following bar chart shows the number of different types of animals at two county fairs. Fair X had a total of 645 animals, and fair Y had a total of 590 animals.
content.question: Which of the following statements is supported by the bar chart?

choices.label: The total number of cows, pigs, and horses combined is less at fair X than at fair Y.
Fair X has at least 20 more chickens than fair Y.
At fair X, the number of sheep is twice the number of horses.
The percentage of all animals at fair Y that are goats is equal to the percentage of all animals at fair X that are goats.
The percentage of all animals at fair Y that are goats is greater than the percentage of all animals at fair X that are goats.

content.answer: The percentage of all animals at fair Y that are goats is greater than the percentage of all animals at fair X that are goats.

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
